column4: I have Windows 7, and im trying to dual boot with Ubuntu 10.04, im not seeing the "install side by side" option when trying to install, what may cause this ?
Ubuntu isn't giving me an option to resize my partition, so I can't dual boot
what is the current OS?
Windows 7
win7 can resize its own partitions
I just finished a defrag, and I have 210GB free, I am better using Windows 7 to resize the partition ?
and 30Gb is plenty for Ubuntu?
yes as it will manage its own files etc
most netbooks get by with about 4Gb
what is recommended swap partition size?
2xram for less than 2Gb. 1xram for 2gb or more
if you have a stupendous amount of ram it may not even be needed
then 4gb swap wil be fine. it will enable hibernate etc
so I allocate 4GB swap on disk also ?
yes
so thats 4gb ram + 4gb swap, is that too much?
CaptainTrek, joaopinto  thanks guys
if you just want to web browse an d chat etc then swap isnt needed, depends what the ubuntu os is for
its more for experimentation, I havent messed with ubuntu since 8.10
then you can omit it if you want, but 4gb is the norm for 4gb ram
I will try that now, thanks.. Chat to you later.
